overlayDistricts.description: The Uptown Arts-Mixed Use (ARTS) Overlay District was established to encourage retail, entertainment and residential uses

The Capitol Interest (CAP) Overlay District was established to promote and protect the public health, safety, and general welfare of the U.S. Capitol precinct and the area adjacent to this jurisdiction, in a manner consistent with the goals and mandates of the United States Congress.

The Capitol Gateway (CG) Overlay District was established to provide use, height, density, combined lot development, and design requirements to ensure an appropriate mixture of residential and commercial uses and suitable height, bulk, and design of buildings.

The Capitol Hill Commercial (CHC) Overlay District was established to implement those land use objectives and policies related to improving the physical condition of Capitol Hill through the provision of functional, efficient, and attractive commercial areas.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1570 through 1573 of the Zoning Regulations.

overlayDistricts.district: Cleveland Park Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District (CP)
overlayDistricts.description: The Cleveland Park Neighborhood Commercial (CP) Overlay District was established to provide for safe and efficient pedestrian movement; to encourage compatibility of development with the Historic Landmark and Historic District Protection Act of 1978; and to provide for retention of existing housing to help meet the need for affordable housing.

The Diplomatic (D) Overlay District was established to implement the Foreign Missions Act and is mapped at suitable locations in the District pursuant to the Act and the Foreign Missions and International Organizations element of the Comprehensive Plan.

overlayDistricts.district: Eighth Street Southeast Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District (ES)
overlayDistricts.description: The Eighth Street Southeast Neighborhood Commercial (ES) Overlay District was established to encourage and allow new business and office development in close proximity to the Navy Yard, with emphasis on firms that will conduct business with the Navy, as well as neighborhood-serving retail and service businesses.

The Foggy Bottom (FB) Overlay District was established to require the scale of development to be consistent with the Comprehensive Plan and the characteristics of the low-scale residential neighborhood.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1521 through 1524 of the Zoning Regulations.

overlayDistricts.district: Forest Hills Tree and Slope Protection Overlay District (FH)
overlayDistricts.description: The Forest Hills Tree and Slope Protection (FH/TSP) Overlay District was established to preserve and enhance the park-like setting of certain designated neighborhoods including Soapstone Valley and Melvin C. Hazen Park.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1516 through 1520 of the Zoning Regulations.

overlayDistricts.description: The Fort Totten (FT) Overlay District was established to allow existing industrial businesses to remain and expand and to propose land use control policies to further implement the Comprehensive Plan.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1561 through 1564 of the Zoning Regulations

overlayDistricts.district: Georgia Avenue Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District (GA)
overlayDistricts.description: The Georgia Avenue (GA) Overlay District was established to encourage additional residential uses and improved commercial uses; to provide uniform building design standards and set guidelines for development review for PUD and special exception proceedings; and to encourage vertically-mixed uses.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1327 through 1331 of the Zoning Regulations

overlayDistricts.district: H Street Northeast Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District (HS)
overlayDistricts.description: The H Street (HS) Northeast Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District was established to provide use, density, design, and planned unit development requirements for lots fronting on H Street, N.E. from 2nd Street to 15th Street, N.E.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1320 through 1326 of the Zoning Regulations.

overlayDistricts.description: The Hotel/Residential (HR) Incentive Overlay District was established to encourage construction of hotels and apartment houses to further elements of the District of Columbia's development plans, including goals in employment, population, transportation, housing, public facilities, and environmental quality.

The Langdon Overlay (LO) District was established to implement the Comprehensive Plan by protecting residences and residents from the adverse environmental, safety, and aesthetic impacts of abutting industrially zoned properties and uses.

The Macomb-Wisconsin Neighborhood Commercial (MW) Overlay District was established to provide public review of large developments in respect to their proposed uses, vehicular access, and the scale and massing of proposed buildings.

The Naval Observatory Precinct (NO) Overlay District was established to promote the public health, safety, and general welfare on land adjacent to or in close proximity to the highly sensitive and historically important Naval Observatory.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1531 through 1534 of the Zoning Regulations.

overlayDistricts.description: The Reed-Cooke (RC) Overlay District was established to protect existing housing and provide for the development of new housing; maintain heights and densities at appropriate levels, encourage small-scale business development that will not adversely affect the residential community.

The Southeast Federal Center (SEFC) Overlay District was established to provide for the development of a vibrant, urban, mixed-use waterfront neighborhood, offering a combination of uses that will attract residents, office workers, and visitors from across the District and beyond.

The Sixteenth Street Heights (SSH) Overlay District was established to preserve and enhance the residential character of the neighborhood by regulating the expansion of non-residential uses of residential property, regulating the expansion of existing non-residential uses, and preserving residential housing units.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1551 through 1553 of the Zoning Regulations.

overlayDistricts.description: The Takoma (TK) Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District was established to reserve sufficient open space to provide adequate light and air to encourage retail and service uses and for pedestrian circulation around the Takoma Metro station.

overlayDistricts.district: Tree and Slope Protection Overlay District (TSP)
overlayDistricts.description: The Tree and Slope Protection (TSP) Overlay District was established to preserve and enhance the park-like setting of designated neighborhoods adjacent to streams or parks.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1511 through 1515 of the Zoning Regulations

overlayDistricts.description: The Wesley Heights (WH) Overlay District was established to preserve and enhance the low density character of Wesley Heights by regulating construction and alteration of residential and other buildings in the area.
overlayDistricts.lookup: Sections 1541 through 1543 of the Zoning Regulations

overlayDistricts.district: Woodley Park Neighborhood Commercial Overlay District (WP)
overlayDistricts.description: The Woodley Park Neighborhood Commercial (WP) Overlay District was established to provide for safe and efficient pedestrian movement, so as to improve access to retail services, the Metrorail station, and other uses in the area.
